In pilot study patient CIPN , evidence Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation ( TENS ) improve painful symptom patient CIPN . This study aim investigate effect TENS reduce symptom pain numbness improve daily life cancer patient CIPN . 1 . Primary Objectives Evaluate effect TENS reduction symptom related peripheral neuropathy due chemotherapy treatment high moderate neurotoxic potential cancer patient . Eligibility criterion : The participant research include patient cancer diagnosis subject chemotherapy either adjuvant neoadjuvant therapy , contain protocol least one chemotherapeutic drug moderate high neurotoxic potential . The participant research receive TENS within follow parameter : VF mode TENS variable frequency 7 Hz 65 Hz . It pulse width 200 µs , high tolerable intensity still remain comfortable patient . It application time 60 minute high tolerable intensity , still remain comfortable patient . The treatment give day chemotherapy , give home within 3 cycle . The participant divide 2 group : Experimental Group ( EG ) administer active TENS Control Group ( CG ) administer placebo TENS . The evaluation effect measure follow instrument : Classification neuropathy CTCAE ( Common Terminology Criteria Adverse Events ) version 4.02 2009 , scale functionality ECOG , Questionnaire Neurotoxicity Induced Antineoplastics ( QNIA ) evaluation symptom CIPN , Analogue Visual Scale ( AVS ) ass symptom pain paresthesia .
